attributes.name: acquisitionDetails
attributes.description: Details of acquisition of the asset, e.g. acquirer, asset type, asset class, etc.

attributes.name: additionType
attributes.description: Category or type of asset, e.g. Plant and Machinery, PPE or similar.

attributes.name: approvedBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for person who approved the entry.

attributes.name: approvedByDate
attributes.description: The date the entry was approved.

attributes.name: assetCategoryId
attributes.description: Identifier of the asset category.

attributes.name: businessUnitCode
attributes.description: Used to identify the business unit, region, branch, etc. at the level that financial statements are being audited and for which the trial balance is generated. For example, you may use a code aligned with the concept of a reportable segment as defined in FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 280, Segment Reporting.

attributes.name: enteredBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for person who created the record.

attributes.name: enteredDate
attributes.description: The date the addition was entered into the system. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date. This should be a system-generated date (rather than user-entered date), when possible. This date does not necessarily correspond with the date of the transaction itself.

attributes.name: fixedAssetAdditionDate
attributes.description: The date on which the addition was included on the system.

attributes.name: fixedAssetAdditionId
attributes.description: ID of the addition record relating to this asset.

attributes.name: fixedAssetCost
attributes.description: In the header's default currency the cost at which the fixed asset was acquired from the vendor or built.

attributes.name: fixedAssetId
attributes.description: ID associated with fixed asset.

attributes.name: fixedAssetUniqueId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the fixed asset. May need to be created by combining multiple fields e.g. BusinessUnitCode, fixedAssetId.

attributes.name: glAccount
attributes.description: Identifier for the GL account code associated with the asset. glAccountNumber in this file must match the glAccountNumber used in the glDetail, trialBalance and chartOfAccounts

attributes.name: glTransactionId
attributes.description: Transaction ID in the GL for the transaction recognising asset addition.

attributes.name: inUseFlag
attributes.description: Indicator used to determine whether the asset is in use.

attributes.name: intangibleAssetFlag
attributes.description: Indicates whether the asset is an intangible asset.

attributes.name: inventorial
attributes.description: Indicates whether the asset should be included in physical inventory.

attributes.name: lastModifiedBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for the last person modifying this entry.

attributes.name: lastModifiedByDate
attributes.description: The modifying date for the last person modifying the fixed asset addition entry.

attributes.name: leaseId
attributes.description: Identifier of the capital or operating lease.

attributes.name: leaseIndicator
attributes.description: Indicates whether asset is owned or leased.

attributes.name: lotNumber
attributes.description: Identification number assigned to a particular quantity or lot of material or depending on the asset classified.

attributes.name: modelNumber
attributes.description: Model number assigned to the asset by the manufacturer.

attributes.name: newUsed
attributes.description: Option indicating whether asset is new or used.

attributes.name: parentAssetId
attributes.description: Identifier of the parent asset for the child or component asset.

attributes.name: placedInService
attributes.description: Point in time when the asset is first placed in use for the purpose of accounting, primarily to calculate depreciation or grant a tax credit.

attributes.name: propertyTypeCode
attributes.description: Option indicating whether the asset is considered personal, real, or residential property.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderDate
attributes.description: The date of the purchase order, regardless of the date the order is entered. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderId
attributes.description: Purchase order ID associated with the purchase of the fixed asset.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderRaisedDate
attributes.description: The date of raising the purchase order for the fixed asset acquisition.

attributes.name: segment01
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment02
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment03
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment04
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment05
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: serialNumber
attributes.description: Serial number for asset, used by manufacturer for identification.

attributes.name: supplierId
attributes.description: Identifier of the supplier from whom the asset was purchased and to whom payment is due. Must match the supplierId in supplierMasterData.

attributes.name: supplierName
attributes.description: Name of the supplier.

attributes.name: tagNumber
attributes.description: Unique user-defined tracking number for an asset.

attributes.name: userDefined1
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: userDefined2
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: vatCode
attributes.description: Code confirming which VAT category the asset falls into.

attributes.name: warrantyId
attributes.description: Identifier of the warranty defined for the asset.
